main event: A woman reported seeing a 'saucer' that was about 8 feet above the ground and had two ordinary house rooms, metallic gray in color, connected by a large metallic band, while driving from her home in a suburb of Chicago to her home in a suburb of Chicago on May 20, 1958 around 8:00 PM.
interesting points: The woman was described as a rational and sensible person, married with a son in some research work.
The sighting was reported on May 12, 1958, about a week after the incident.
The letter mentions that the writer had the pleasure of hearing Dr. Walter Uphoff speak at the planetarium and had used his book on flying saucers for a planetarium show.
Donald H. Menzel, the Director of Project Blue Book, responded to the woman's report, suggesting the 'saucer' was likely an 'inferior mirage' of the sky, seen against a roadway.
Menzel requested the woman send him as much information as possible about the sighting, times, directions, locations, sky, and so on.
sighted object: a metallic gray 'saucer' about 8 feet above the ground with two ordinary house rooms connected by a large metallic band
witnesses: A rational and sensible woman, married with a son in some research work
